questions.question: I was not allowed ………………………
questions.description: Allow is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Please let him .......................
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You ought .................. a doctor.
questions.description: Ought is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: They made me .....................
questions.description: When made is used in the active voice, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I was made ....................... my right to the property.
questions.description: When made is in the passive voice, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I am not able …………………………….. this problem.
questions.description: Be able is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I can’t ………………………….. it anymore.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after modals.

questions.question: I forgot .................... the door before going out.
questions.description: Forget is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You don't need ....................... your own device.
questions.description: When need is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You need not ........................ for my drinks.
questions.description: When need is a modal auxiliary, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: She refused ......................... with the interrogators.
questions.description: Refuse is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I was forced ....................... up my claim.
